<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// An XCOFF object file has a limited set of predefined sections. The most</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// important ones for us (right now) are:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// .text --&gt; contains program code and read-only data.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// .data --&gt; contains initialized data, function descriptors, and the TOC.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// .bss  --&gt; contains uninitialized data.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Each of these sections is composed of &#39;Control Sections&#39;. A Control Section</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is more commonly referred to as a csect. A csect is an indivisible unit of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// code or data, and acts as a container for symbols. A csect is mapped</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into a section based on its storage-mapping class, with the exception of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// XMC&#95;RW which gets mapped to either .data or .bss based on whether it&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// explicitly initialized or not.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We don&#39;t represent the sections in the MC layer as there is nothing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// interesting about them at at that level: they carry information that is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// only relevant to the ObjectWriter, so we materialize them in this class.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-xcoffobjectwriter-cpp-"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">namespace </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// XCOFF has special section numbers for symbols:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// -2 Specifies N&#95;DEBUG, a special symbolic debugging symbol.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// -1 Specifies N&#95;ABS, an absolute symbol. The symbol has a value but is not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// relocatable.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  0 Specifies N&#95;UNDEF, an undefined external symbol.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Therefore, we choose -3 (N&#95;DEBUG - 1) to represent a section index that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// hasn&#39;t been initialized.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#42;) Builds up the section header table by adding any non-empty sections to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="723"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a88ee8e4eea43084bd8964682683da88caa1fa27779242b4902f7ae3bdd5c6d508">Type</a> == XCOFF::RelocationType::R&#95;TOC ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00724" /><CodeLine lineNumber="724"><Highlight kind="normal">           <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a88ee8e4eea43084bd8964682683da88caa1fa27779242b4902f7ae3bdd5c6d508">Type</a> == XCOFF::RelocationType::R&#95;TOCL) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00725" /><CodeLine lineNumber="725"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For non toc-data external symbols, R&#95;TOC type relocation will relocate to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00726" /><CodeLine lineNumber="726"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// data symbols that have XCOFF::XTY&#95;SD type csect. For toc-data external</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00727" /><CodeLine lineNumber="727"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// symbols, R&#95;TOC type relocation will relocate to data symbols that have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00728" /><CodeLine lineNumber="728"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// XCOFF&#95;ER type csect. For XCOFF&#95;ER kind symbols, there will be no TOC</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00729" /><CodeLine lineNumber="729"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// entry for them, so the FixedValue should always be 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00730" /><CodeLine lineNumber="730"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SymASec-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcsectionxcoff/#af79b6732b23bd4070d16bc96bfbdbb15">getCSectType</a>() == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/xcoff/#ae6213556e13de39091f6861f199d7b1fad8a6731bed03a3891075d7ba162f83ba">XCOFF::XTY&#95;ER</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00731" /><CodeLine lineNumber="731"><Highlight kind="normal">      FixedValue = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00732" /><CodeLine lineNumber="732"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00733" /><CodeLine lineNumber="733"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The FixedValue should be the TOC entry offset from the TOC-base plus</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00734" /><CodeLine lineNumber="734"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// any constant offset value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00735" /><CodeLine lineNumber="735"><Highlight kind="normal">      int64&#95;t TOCEntryOffset = SectionMap&#91;SymASec&#93;-&gt;Address -</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00736" /><CodeLine lineNumber="736"><Highlight kind="normal">                               TOCCsects.front().Address + <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpu/exp/#af7592dc94276d1958420bcfb414b6998">Target</a>.getConstant();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="737"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For small code model, if the TOCEntryOffset overflows the 16-bit value,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="738"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we truncate it back down to 16 bits. The linker will be able to insert</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="739"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// fix-up code when needed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00740" /><CodeLine lineNumber="740"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For non toc-data symbols, we already did the truncation in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00741" /><CodeLine lineNumber="741"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// PPCAsmPrinter.cpp through setting Target.getConstant() in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00742" /><CodeLine lineNumber="742"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// expression above by calling getTOCEntryLoadingExprForXCOFF for the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00743" /><CodeLine lineNumber="743"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// various TOC PseudoOps.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00744" /><CodeLine lineNumber="744"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For toc-data symbols, we were not able to calculate the offset from</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00745" /><CodeLine lineNumber="745"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the TOC in PPCAsmPrinter.cpp since the TOC has not been finalized at</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00746" /><CodeLine lineNumber="746"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that point, so we are adjusting it here though</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00747" /><CodeLine lineNumber="747"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// llvm::SignExtend64&lt;16&gt;(TOCEntryOffset);</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00748" /><CodeLine lineNumber="748"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: Since the time that the handling for offsets over 16-bits was</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00749" /><CodeLine lineNumber="749"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// added in PPCAsmPrinter.cpp using getTOCEntryLoadingExprForXCOFF, the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00750" /><CodeLine lineNumber="750"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// system assembler and linker have been updated to be able to handle the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="751"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// overflowing offsets, so we no longer need to keep</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="752"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// getTOCEntryLoadingExprForXCOFF.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="753"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a88ee8e4eea43084bd8964682683da88caa1fa27779242b4902f7ae3bdd5c6d508">Type</a> == XCOFF::RelocationType::R&#95;TOC &amp;&amp; !<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1a1e51a5952c3afa00875df90e7ae6f8">isInt&lt;16&gt;</a>(TOCEntryOffset))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="754"><Highlight kind="normal">        TOCEntryOffset = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad12a58d7f81a304e0c568ad2210bc4fe">llvm::SignExtend64&lt;16&gt;</a>(TOCEntryOffset);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="755"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="756"><Highlight kind="normal">      FixedValue = TOCEntryOffset;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="757"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="764"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The address of the branch instruction should be the sum of section</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="765"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// address, fragment offset and Fixup offset.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="766"><Highlight kind="normal">    uint64&#95;t BRInstrAddress =</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="770"><Highlight kind="normal">    FixedValue = getVirtualAddress(SymA, SymASec) - BRInstrAddress +</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;relocation for paired relocatable term is not yet supported&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a88ee8e4eea43084bd8964682683da88caa1fa27779242b4902f7ae3bdd5c6d508">Type</a> == XCOFF::RelocationType::R&#95;POS &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="800"><Highlight kind="normal">         </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;SymA must be R&#95;POS here if it&#39;s not opposite term or paired &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><Highlight kind="normal">         </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;relocatable term.&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> uint32&#95;t IndexB = getIndex(SymB, SymBSec);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SymB must be R&#95;NEG here, given the general form of Target(MCValue) is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &quot;SymbolA - SymbolB + imm64&quot;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> uint8&#95;t TypeB = XCOFF::RelocationType::R&#95;NEG;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><Highlight kind="normal">  XCOFFRelocation RelocB = &#123;IndexB, FixupOffsetInCsect, SignAndSize, TypeB&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><Highlight kind="normal">  SectionMap&#91;RelocationSec&#93;-&gt;Relocations.push&#95;back(RelocB);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="808"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We already folded &quot;SymbolA + imm64&quot; above when Type is R&#95;POS for SymbolA,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// now we just need to fold &quot;- SymbolB&quot; here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><Highlight kind="normal">  FixedValue -= getVirtualAddress(SymB, SymBSec);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1241"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1242"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This field specifies the file section number of the section header that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1243"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// overflowed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1250"><Highlight kind="normal">    OverflowSections.push&#95;back(std::move(SecEntry));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1251"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1252"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The field in the primary section header is always 65535</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1716"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Takes the log base 2 of the alignment and shifts the result into the 5 most</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1717"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// significant bits of a byte, then or&#39;s in the csect type into the least</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01721" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1721"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Result is a number in the range &#91;0, 31&#93; which fits in the 5 least</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
